project_metadata.name: The Grid Nexus Optimization
project_metadata.mission: Dominate the intersection of Technology, Cybersecurity, and Gaming news.

workflow_rules: ALWAYS analyze the file structure before suggesting changes.
Use 'Nexus-Style' coding: modular components, strictly typed TypeScript, and mobile-first Tailwind classes.
When generating content or code, cross-reference the 'competitor_outperformance_plan' to ensure unique value.
For every new component, automatically generate a corresponding test file.

phase_1_content_velocity.objective: Scale content production by 300% without quality loss

cursor_commands.auto_summarize: Create a server-side utility that uses OpenAI API to generate a 'TL;DR' bullet list and a 'Key Takeaways' box for every article based on content length.
cursor_commands.smart_tagging: Implement an NLP service (using libraries like 'natural' or external APIs) to scan article bodies and auto-assign tags like 'Zero-Day', 'Ransomware', or 'GPU' to boost internal linking.

phase_2_nexus_intelligence.objective: Build the 'Nexus Brain' for user retention

features.name: Nexus Bot (Semantic Search)
features.tech: Pinecone Vector DB + Vercel AI SDK
features.cursor_instruction: Scaffold a chat interface component allowing users to query your article database (e.g., 'Is the new GTA 6 trailer safe from malware links?').

features.name: Dynamic Personalization
features.cursor_instruction: Write middleware that reads user cookies to detect 'interest_clusters' (e.g., Security vs. Gaming) and re-orders the homepage grid server-side.

schema_automation.instruction: Automatically inject JSON-LD schema into the <head> of every page.

core_web_vitals.cursor_check: Before any pull request, check that all images use 'next/image' with appropriate 'sizes' props and 'priority' is set for above-the-fold content.

google_discover_optimization.instruction: Ensure the OG:Image generation script creates 1200x675px images with high-contrast text overlays automatically.
google_discover_optimization.tactic: Trend-Jacking: If a keyword like 'RTX 5090' spikes, prioritize generating a 'Security Analysis' of that hardware.

competitor_matrix.name: BleepingComputer
competitor_matrix.our_angle: Cybersecurity news that looks beautiful and reads easily

competitor_matrix.name: The Verge
competitor_matrix.our_angle: Deep-dive technical specificity at the intersection of gaming/sec

winning_tactics.speed_to_index: Implement Google Indexing API to ping search engines immediately upon publishing 'Critical' alerts.
winning_tactics.cross_pollination: Every gaming article MUST have a 'Security Note' sidebar; every security article MUST mention relevant consumer tech.

coding_guidelines.accessibility: Strict WCAG 2.1 AA compliance. All interactive elements must have aria-labels.
coding_guidelines.images: All tags must have dynamic alt text based on the article keywords.
coding_guidelines.performance: No heavy client-side libraries (like Lodash) unless absolutely necessary. Prefer native ES6+.
